name: Maggie S
comment info: In this graph, I notice that gas was the product that stood out most to people. Covid and everything going on with the world today has ruined a lot of different countries economies. There is such a large demand for the basic necessities but a supply shortage for all of these products. Milk, meat, beef, chicken, and eggs are all greatly consumed products in the world and so there is a huge demand for these foods because we live in a time where no one knows what will happen next. Recently, specifically within the last month, gas prices have grown higher than ever. This is because of the war between Ukraine and Russia. I wonder how long it is going to take for the gas prices to go down after the war ends. I also wonder if the crisis in Ukraine is going to affect products like milk, meat, etc., harsher in the next few weeks. This affects me and my community because I see these prices every day and I have to pay for these prices. A catchy headline is "Product Prices Increasing, Supply of Products Decreasing!"

replies.name: D
replies.comment info:
Thank you for your comment, @Justin!  The number in the subscript of each word represents the number of respondents who submitted that item in the survey when asked to name specific products and services whose higher prices have stood out over the past year.  For example, 904 (of the 2200 who participated in the creation of the word cloud) submitted “gas.”

It’s not about which items are going up in price, it’s about the perceptions of the respondents – which items have had price increases in the past year that stood out.  What is inflation?  Have prices of everything (or almost everything) increased in the past year?  If so, are people perceiving these price increases, and have the have the price increases affected them?  Is inflation affecting everyone similarly, or are some people suffering more (or less) than others?

Come back on Friday when we reveal a link to a free article in which the journalists use this graph and provide some insight.

name: Sharon Hessney
comment info:
Welcome to Wednesday's live moderation of “What’s Going On in This Graph?”  

Today’s graph shows the Feb. 2022 responses to the survey question:  Name specific products and services whose higher prices have stood out to them over the past year.  

From 9 am – 2 pm E.T. today, share with us your responses online to these three questions -- "What do you notice?”, “What do you wonder?"  and “How will this affect you and your community?”  Plus, please share with us a catchy headline that captures the ideas in this graph. 

By Friday morning, we’ll reveal the article that included this graph and much more.  We look forward to reading your discoveries.

Note that you can get a link to your response to share with your teacher and classmates by clicking the response box below your response “Email me when my comment is published.”
